result.execSummary:
The defendant Edwin Ali Vazquez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law if not previously provided.  Defendant must pay mandatory DNA surcharge. Firearm warning given. Ineligible voting notice and acknowledgement

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Edwin Ali Vazquez

records.addlTxt: Notice of Completion of Representation
Per RCSO, DNA collected - 10-24-22 @ 9:45

9:32 AM Defendant Edwin Ali Vazquez in court.  Attorney Ashley Castro in court for Edwin Ali Vazquez.  Prosecuting attorney Chris D Steenrod in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter: Sara Rogan. 
Parties are prepared to proceed with plea/sentencing today. 

State puts offer on the record. Defense confirms offer. 

Plea questionnaire filed. Court holds plea colloquy with defendant. 

Plea - GUILTY. 
Agreement to use complaint for factual basis. 
BTC: GUILTY.
Parties give arguments as to sentencing. 

BTC: 
Firearm warning given. Ineligible voting notice and acknowledgement 
Deft is Ordered to provide a DNA specimen;
$500 fine+ Court Costs+ DNA surcharge, payment plan $50/month beginning 12/1/22.

8:35 AM Defendant Edwin Ali Vazquez in court.  Attorney Elizabeth Angove on behalf of Ashley Castro in court for Edwin Ali Vazquez.  Prosecuting attorney Chris D Steenrod in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter Sara Rogan. 
Defense has the discovery but just needs time to review it with his client, requests another date. 
BTC: Matter set over.
Status conference scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on October 24, 2022 at 09:00 am.

State's Notice of Intent to introduce certified medical records

State's Notice of Intent to introduce expert testimony
Racine County Pretrial Risk Assessment Report

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit. It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances. This is to be monitored through random drug screens and/or breathalyzers by the Racine County Alternatives Program, Room MC340 (Law Enforcement Center 717 Wisconsin Ave Racine WI 53403). New referrals from Court must report on the day of their Court appearance.  Jail releases must report the following business day (M-Fr 8am-4:30pm).  In addition to random testing, the defendant is further ordered to test after each court appearance.

2:05 PM Prosecuting attorney Brian Van Schyndel in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Edwin Ali Vazquez appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Juan Sebastian Ramirez appeared by video for Edwin Ali Vazquez. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. 
State moves to orally mend statue number.
BTC: Motion to orally amend granted, state to file and amended complaint.  Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 14, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on July 14, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Initial appearance on June 29, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Pursuant to Wisconsin's Supreme Court Order issued March 22, 2020 this hearing being held via video and telephone conferencing. You may view this hearing by using the following link:  https://www.wicourts.gov/courts/livestream.htm, Racine County, Judicial Court Commissioner
